Articles.Content:
Hello everyone,

I heard about this game from a friend, saw some of the YouTube videos, tried out the demo and brought version 0.90 about 2 weeks ago.

Having fun so far, but I think I need a new computer
Hi, and welcome to the forums!

Hi, and welcome to the forums!

Thanks!

Welcome.

When you get a new computer can I have your old one, it's probably still better than mine ^^.

If you have bought KSP you have bought KSP, not just version 0.90. The current version is the real, not-beta-any-more-honest, 1.0.2 (unless there's been another bug-fix patch since I last looked). It's a lot more realistic and free to update.

Like you, I tried the demo (mostly to see if it would even run on this old machine) and was so awestruck at that I had no hesitation in reaching for my wallet. It was a good investment and only destroyed the rest the of my life for a little over a year *grin*
Hi and welcome. This game runs really good on video cards a couple years old, so long as your CPU has some juice to it for the physics calculations.

Thanks everyone,

I think the CPU & graphics cards are ok, I'm just a bit short of RAM.
